text: Hi, Want to understand typically how rule evaluations are done in chaincode.  In typical enterprise systems the rules are maintained externally on rule engines. If the chaincode has to evaluate the rules then they can be invoked from chaincode.  However, this may introduce a non-deterministic behaviour. Any thoughts how the rule evaluations should be done? Thanks

Hi All, i have a question regarding ledger database..

I want to get the details of column families

var columnfamilies = []string{
    blockchainCF, // blocks of the block chain
    stateCF,      // world state
    stateDeltaCF, // open transaction state
    indexesCF,    // tx uuid -> blockno
    persistCF,    // persistent per-peer state (consensus)
}

Any idea??? plz help.
i have created a table with `stub.CreateTable(...)` is there any opportunity to get the number of rows?
so if i have table which i have filled with rows and i want to get a specific entry (i.e. a specific column) of the row. how do i do that?

hey all, 
I am using NodeSDK to deploy my chaincode and I am running in non-dev mode. 
My doubt is whether we can give remote repo path as chaincodePath or is this mandatory for it to be a local system path only?
